etymologies: late 18th century: from steeple(because originally a steeple marked the finishing point across country) + chase

definitions: a horse race run on a racecourse having ditches and hedges as jumps

examples.text: the horse had all the attributes to win her the greatest steeplechase in the calendar
the breed is used for flat racing as opposed to harness racing or steeplechase

shortDefinitions: horse race run on racecourse having ditches and hedges as jumps

definitions: a running race in which runners must clear hurdles and water jumps

examples.text: he will run his first international steeplechase in America

shortDefinitions: running race in which runners must clear hurdles and water jumps
